ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Important thread to support on Whineplay!
ygData.msgSnippet: You know, now that I think about it.  None of my Druid s nor my enchanter s spells stop working after a certain level, except the one s that get specific
ygData.messageBody:
You know, now that I think about it. None of my Druid's nor my enchanter's
spells stop working after a certain level, except the one's that get
specific upgrades at the same time as they become ineffective. Why is it
that VI feels it's okay that certain bard songs stop being useful at some
point when there is no upgrade that provides the same functionality back
into our repertoire?

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Mott, Mike J. [mailto:mike.j.mott@...]
Sent: Friday, October 20, 2000 9:55 AM
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Important thread to support on Whineplay!


ROFLMAO

What about the "make the creature really pissed at me and kick the
crap out of me instead of you song?"

> Gosh! I'll get right on that!
>
> Quick question on the subject of Clarity. More rhetorical than anything,
> I
> suppose.
>
> Why, oh why does every caster in creation call our most requested piece
> the
> "mana song" yet they ask for Clarity by name from Enchanters?
>
> How about some professional courtesty here!
>
> Maybe then I won't feel so bad about mixing in the "stopping you from
> dying"
> song or the "make you hit a lil bit harder, a lil bit faster" song.
>
>
>
> Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
> with the subject submissions.
>


Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.
